message_1: Solve for x: log(x+4) - log(x-1) = log(10)
message_2:
To solve the equation log(x+4) - log(x-1) = log(10), we will use the properties of logarithms.

1. Combine the logarithms on the left side of the equation using the quotient rule: log(a) - log(b) = log(a/b)

log((x+4)/(x-1)) = log(10)

2. Since the logarithms are equal, their arguments must also be equal:

(x+4)/(x-1) = 10

3. Now, solve for x:

(x+4) = 10(x-1)

x + 4 = 10x - 10

4 + 10 = 10x - x

14 = 9x

x = 14/9

So, x = 14/9.
